intro: Kaukenia timorensis, commonly known as the Timor kaukenia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often found in coastal areas and prefers well-drained sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
